Articles.Content:
Kerbonov KN-2 Cockpit Mod and the Firespitter parts pack were used to make this, and all the rights to them are reserved to their rightful owners. I take no credit for making the plugins whatsoever.

This is my very first .craft upload, so give me constructive criticism. It is a soviet-era propeller monoplane reconnaissance aircraft, and is extremely fuel efficient, with plenty of thrust. Since the Kerbonov KN-2 cockpit didn't come with a built in craft file, I just thought it would be nice to provide one.

Here's a link to the .craft download. It is a dropbox file.

Here's a screenshot of it so you see what it looks like before you download it.

--INSTALL INSTRUCTIONS--

Take the .craft file and find your Kerbal Space Program directory, go to the Ships folder, go into the SPH folder, and paste the .craft file into there.

Edited January 14, 2016 by TotallyNotJeb

Nice, looks vaguely like an AN-2 without the lower wing.

Might save you some time, you don't need to tell people what to do with a .craft file or where to put it. Everyone knows ;-)

It is missing the lower wing, but I decided for it to be a monoplane. It also makes it more stable for some reason.

Edited April 22, 2017 by TotallyNotJeb

Hey, it looks like a nice place, reminds me of the civilian planes you see flying (Cessnas? I don't know, I'm not big on civilian planes). Anyway, let me go ahead and embed that screenshot for you, all you have to do it right click and click "Copy Image". It makes it easier for people to see the picture.

22 hours ago, TotallyNotJeb said:

It is missing the lower wing, but I decided for it to be a monoplane. It also makes it more stable for some reason XD

If KSP has even the remotest likeness to RL is simply the lowering of the CoG to a spot clearly below CL.
